title: Ticket #6194: Add signal handler to openmpiscript
description:
Per feedback from H. van Pee via condor-users and personal email. Make sure #! line points (portably) to bash so that shells that do not use bash by default are not confused. Add signal handling as condor_rm may leave hung processes.

Suggested code improvement (H. van Pee): 

#begin signal handler part of openmpiscript from htcondor 8.4.1:
#!/bin/bash
# comments
MY_MPIRUN_PID=0
function mpi_clean_up {

        # Perform program exit housekeeping
echo "openmpiscript " $MY_MPIRUN_PID
if [ "$MY_MPIRUN_PID" -ne "0" ]; then
        echo "The PID is not zero, I will TERM mpirun"
        kill -SIGTERM $MY_MPIRUN_PID
        sleep 60
        sshd_cleanup
        rm -f machines
fi
exit
}
trap mpi_clean_up SIGTERM


# original code until mpirun


## run the actual mpijob
if `ompi_info --param all all | grep orte_rsh_agent 1>/dev/null 2>&1`
then
mpirun -v --prefix $MPDIR --mca orte_rsh_agent $CONDOR_SSH -n
$_CONDOR_NPROCS -hostfile machines $EXECUTABLE $@ &
else
########## For mpi versions 1.1 & 1.2 use the line below
mpirun -v --mca plm_rsh_agent $CONDOR_SSH -n $_CONDOR_NPROCS -hostfile
machines $EXECUTABLE $@ &
fi
MY_MPIRUN_PID=$!
wait $MY_MPIRUN_PID

sshd_cleanup
rm -f machines

exit $?

#end begin signal handler part of openmpiscript from htcondor 8.4.1
remarks:
2017-Apr-04 13:10:14 by jpatton:
Handler added in [50380]. Some differences between the suggested code is that the cleanup function was added later in the script (but before it could be called) so that it comes after the parameters that a user might want to change.

Additionally, a suggestion has been made to add explicit killing of sshd in sshd_cleanup. The mpi proxies have been reported to continue executing on nodes after a condor_rm is issued.
